attributes.name: Thank you for purchasing the Fall of Plaguestone!

attribs.name: immunities
attribs.current: acid, bleed, death effects, disease, doomed, drained, fatigued, healing, necromancy, nonlethal attacks, paralyzed, poison, sickened, unconscious

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-LkzKhID662lvUAJXbkZ_description
attribs.current: An alchemical drudge can vomit forth a pool of caustic alchemical reagents, filling the ground in one square adjacent to the drudge. Creatures in that square when the pool is created take [[2d6]] (2d6) acid damage (DC 17 basic Reflex save). Any creature that ends its turn in a square containing a pool takes [[2d6]] (2d6) acid damage. The pool remains for 1 minute before becoming inert.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-Ll3AizwMMzBOy8ioCxl_description
attribs.current: An alchemical drudge contains a special reservoir that can be loaded with the contents of one alchemical bomb that deals acid, cold, electricity, or fire damage, allowing the drudge to imbue its fist attacks with this damage. Each hit deals [[1d6]] (1d6) points of damage of the same type as that of the bomb loaded into it. Each bomb has enough fluid in it for 10 successful strikes.

attribs.name: repeating_interaction-abilities_-Ll3Bn0mJH1P3xX1cgl8_description
attribs.current: An alchemical drudge can’t speak, but its mind is linked to its creator. It can share basic emotional information with its creator, such as fear, happiness, or anger. If the drudge is destroyed, its master automatically knows this. The range of this link is 1,500 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-LkzUBDM786FGXOr6o2h_description
attribs.current: Each enemy in the swarm’s space takes [[1d4]] (1d4) piercing damage (DC 16 basic Reflex save). The first time each round a creature fails the save and takes piercing damage, it also suffers the effect of beestings. Whenever the bee swarm uses this ability, the swarm takes 1 damage.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-LkzUxiVpj4lpHdIBnkR_description
attribs.current: The creature must attempt a DC 16 Fortitude save. Those who fail take [[1d4]] (1d4) poison damage and are clumsy 1 for 1 minute.

attribs.name: immunities
attribs.current: critical hits, mental, precision, unconscious, visual

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-LkzbaTY0g-uaZiD4YVn_trigger
attribs.current: The blood ooze is damaged by piercing or slashing attack.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-LkzbaTY0g-uaZiD4YVn_description
attribs.current: The blood ooze forms a clot around the wound, reducing the damage taken by 5 (to a minimum of 0).

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-LkzcAc8KYf8d0LT-yKK_description
attribs.current: Whenever a creature adjacent to a blood ooze takes bleed damage, the blood ooze regains an amount of Hit Points equal to the damage dealt.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-LkzdMlwzfPdknUz1ft8_description
attribs.current: The blood ooze draws forth blood from nearby creatures, causing their flesh to break open and blood to spill out which replenishes the blood ooze. Each living creature within 15 feet takes [[3d6]] (3d6) slashing damage (DC 21 basic Fortitude save). The blood ooze regains an amount of Hit Points equal to half the damage Siphon Vitality dealt to the single creature that took the most damage.

attribs.name: stealth_notes
attribs.current: +12 if hiding inside a dead body

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-LlwsLMI0BbeFpCtgrOi_description
attribs.current: A blood ooze can seep into a corpse’s wounds, displacing its natural blood. It can burst out of the corpse as a free action.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-LkzftczFA61eTfiLH3V_description
attribs.current: The tendrils of the bush reach out to siphon the blood from a victim up to 20 feet away with persistent bleed damage, causing the victim to immediately take that amount of bleed damage (basic Reflex DC 17). The bush regains an amount of Hit Points equal to double the damage dealt.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-Lkzg1boP8VEDu8i2mHI_description
attribs.current: The bush spins in a circle, lashing out in all directions at once. It makes one attack roll and compares the result to the AC of each creature within its melee reach, rolling damage only once and applying it to each creature hit.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-LkzgCXDZGQr8yxaLXHk_description
attribs.current: A bloodlash bush’s vines cause terrible lacerations that continue to bleed. A creature hit with a vine attack takes 1 persistent bleed damage (2 on a critical hit). Unlike other forms of persistent damage, this damage is cumulative, to a maximum of 5 persistent bleed damage but it can be stopped like any other persistent bleed damage.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-Lkzhx4oKfmrtwRc1nOT_description
attribs.current: When a bloodseeker hits a target larger than itself, its barbed legs attach it to that creature. This is similar to grabbing the creature, but the bloodseeker moves with that creature rather than holding it in place. The bloodseeker is flat-footed while attached. If the bloodseeker is killed or pushed away while attached to a creature it has drained blood from, that creature takes 1 persistent bleed damage. Escaping the attach or removing the bloodseeker in other ways doesn’t cause bleed damage.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-Lkzi8Rc4jTWZa3WXMqF_description
attribs.current: Requirements The bloodseeker is attached to a creature. Effect The bloodseeker uses its proboscis to drain blood from the creature it’s attached to. This deals [[1d4]] (1d4) damage, and the bloodseeker gains temporary Hit Points equal to the damage dealt. A creature that has its blood drained by a bloodseeker is drained 1 until it receives healing (of any kind or amount).

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-LkzjHc4Zn4bAFDtxztR_description
attribs.current: The boar Strides twice and then makes a tusk Strike. As long as it moved at least 20 feet, it gains a +2 circumstance bonus to its attack roll.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-LlwxdPe5I6fXxw4rDFq_trigger
attribs.current: You would be reduced to 0 Hit Points but not immediately killed.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-LlwxdPe5I6fXxw4rDFq_description
attribs.current: Frequency once per day; Fierceness in battle runs through your blood, and you refuse to fall from your injuries. You avoid being knocked out and remain at 1 Hit Point, and your wounded condition increases by 1.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-LkzklfMiB3dyaHxgw2h_description
attribs.current: The brine shark dives straight down into the water, moving up to twice its swim Speed in a straight vertical line. It can use this ability while grabbing a creature.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-LkzlbxkfarJWs3vKlNA_description
attribs.current: The wolf unleashes a stream of bright green acid from its mouth, coating all creatures in a 30-foot line. All creatures in the line take [[3d6]] (3d6) acid damage (DC 16 basic Reflex save). The caustic wolf cannot use this ability again for 1 minute.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-Lkzlv19X9FJkifBy-Cu_description
attribs.current: The wolf unleashes a terrifying howl, allowing it to Demoralize all enemies within 30 feet. Wolves within 100 feet can spend a reaction to join the howl, causing the effect to emanate from them as well. This affects additional enemies within 30 feet of them and uses the caustic wolf’s Intimidation check with a –4 circumstance penalty. Enemies cannot be affected by the howl more than once, even if they are near more than one howling wolf. All creatures targeted by this effect are temporarily immune for 24 hours.

attribs.name: repeating_interaction-abilities_-LkznHgkkJkg24ddkClJ_description
attribs.current: The cinder rat ignores the concealed condition from smoke.

attribs.name: repeating_interaction-abilities_-Llwz4dwUQG5mukei-V-_description
attribs.current: A creature that enters the aura or begins its turn there must succeed at a DC 22 Fortitude save or become sickened 1. Everything within the aura, including the cinder rat, is concealed by smoke.

attribs.name: repeating_items-worn_-LkzpzVFlIas7fGg7YVM_worn_item
attribs.current: durable farm clothes (counts as padded armor)

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-Ll3PBzNV5cQ6hs7N2ic_description
attribs.current: Creatures that start their turn grappled by a fiery leopard takes [[1d4]] (1d4) fire damage. Anyone attempting to grapple a fiery leopard takes [[1d4]] (1d4) fire damage for each attempt.

attribs.name: repeating_interaction-abilities_-Ll-wP5x38oLizbQXxAX_description
attribs.current: A bat can use its hearing as a precise sense at the listed range.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-Ll-wTk0NFPvJbk2sHaj_trigger
attribs.current: An adjacent enemy damages the giant bat.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-Ll-wTk0NFPvJbk2sHaj_description
attribs.current: The bat makes one or two wing Strikes—one against the triggering creature and one against another adjacent˜creature.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-Ll-xvbbtyxhZD2tfbDv_description
attribs.current: As Attack of Opportunity, but the serpent can use this reaction only if it's coiled.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-Ll-ypZbmweCksOfzw2v_description
attribs.current: The serpent uses an action to coil itself; increasing its reach with its fangs from 5 feet to 10 feet. After the serpent strikes with its fangs, it becomes uncoiled.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-Ll-z0ZVxsplv6EFaQ4j_description
attribs.current:
The serpent rattles its strange metal tail and unleashes a bolt of lightning in a 60-foot line. The bolt deals [[2d10]] (2d10) electricity damage (DC 17 basic Reflex save).
Once the giant lightning serpent uses this ability, it must wait [[1d4]] (1d4) rounds before doing so again.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-Ll0eA8M3okl82n02QMz_trigger
attribs.current: You would be reduced to 0 Hit Points but not immediately killed.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-Ll0eA8M3okl82n02QMz_description
attribs.current: Frequency once per day; Fierceness in battle runs through your blood, and you refuse to fall from your injuries. You avoid being knocked out and remain at 1 Hit Point, and your wounded condition increases by 1.

attribs.name: repeating_ranged-strikes_-Ll0eysOzpNQ0k77n2i1_weapon_display
attribs.current: +4 (deadly 1d10, propulsive, range increment 100 ft., reload 0, volley 30 ft)

attribs.name: repeating_ranged-strikes_-Ll0eysOzpNQ0k77n2i1_weapon_traits
attribs.current: deadly 1d10, propulsive, range increment 100 ft., reload 0, volley 30 ft

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-Ll0fEaxu8F1eA0cnZ0z_description
attribs.current: Graytusk can make two ranged Strikes against two different targets, each at a –2 penalty, Graytusk’s multiple attack penalty increases only after both attacks are made.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-Ll00GYUfv1GTk8sr18k_description
attribs.current: The grizzly bear gains a +2 circumstance bonus to damage rolls against creatures it has grabbed.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-Ll00M5gEyFf3v6srWIO_description
attribs.current: The grizzly bear Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. During the Stride, the grizzly bear gains a +10-foot circumstance bonus to its Speed.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-Ll01yYkZJicnci3ZH0r_description
attribs.current: The dog’s Strikes deal [[1d4]] (1d4) extra damage to creatures within the reach of at least two of the dog’s allies.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-Ll0hn63OuN-FxXSSJtk_description
attribs.current: You lash out at a foe that leaves an opening. Make a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If your attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, you disrupt that action. This Strike doesn’t count toward your multiple attack penalty, and your multiple attack penalty doesn’t apply to this Strike.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-Ll0hn63OuN-FxXSSJtk_trigger
attribs.current: A creature within your reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it’s using.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-Ll0iOJDt9Rf4yCWmwiB_trigger
attribs.current: Hallod scores a critical hit with a melee attack.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-Ll0iOJDt9Rf4yCWmwiB_description
attribs.current: Hallod can attempt an Athletics check to Shove or Trip the target of his attack. This uses the same multiple attack penalty as the attack, but it does not count as an additional attack for that penalty.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-Ll0ilwzNkbKNwjq8GHg_description
attribs.current: Hallod deals [[1d6]] (1d6) extra precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-LlwZgQdBaA9t8clsq0j_description
attribs.current: Hallod makes two Strikes, one with each hand; he usually attacks first with his kukri. If this first attack hits, the target is flat-footed to the second attack (which for Hallod is usually a fist Strike). The multiple attack penalty applies to these attacks as normal.

attribs.name: languages
attribs.current: Common (can't speak any language); master link

attribs.name: immunities
attribs.current: bleed, death effects, disease, doomed, drained, fatigued, healing, necromancy, nonlethal attacks, paralyzed, poison, sickened, unconscious

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-Ll05UUljAf2JAje7TW3_description
attribs.current: (poison); A homunculus has one dose of poison in a reservoir in its head. It can refill this poison from its reserves with an Interact action. Saving Throw DC 15 Fortitude; Maximum Duration 6 rounds; Stage 1 [[1d6]] (1d6) poison and enfeebled 1 (1 round)

attribs.name: repeating_interaction-abilities_-Ll3TMdzVzLdeds5KV1Z_description
attribs.current: A homunculus can’t speak, but it is telepathically linked to its creator. It can share information back and forth, including its master’s knowledge and everything the homunculus hears. The range of this link is 1,500 feet. The homunculus adopts the same alignment as its creator and is utterly faithful. If the homunculus is destroyed, the master takes [[2d10]] (2d10) mental damage. If the master is slain, the homunculus becomes mindless, claims its current location as its lair, and instinctively attacks anyone who comes near.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-Ll07zNqg2fVufbxqSgu_description
attribs.current: When an icy rat is slain, its body explodes in a burst of frozen fur and bone, dealing [[2d4]] (2d4) cold damage to all adjacent creatures (DC 14 basic Reflex save).

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-Ll0kf2yeoj9vewwIyP2_trigger
attribs.current: You would be reduced to 0 Hit Points but not immediately killed.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-Ll0kf2yeoj9vewwIyP2_description
attribs.current: Frequency once per day; Fierceness in battle runs through your blood, and you refuse to fall from your injuries. You avoid being knocked out and remain at 1 Hit Point, and your wounded condition increases by 1.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-Ll0lclXeX-MHu37W54M_description
attribs.current: Lord Nar may move up to his speed but must end his move as close to the triggering creature as possible without entering the triggering creature’s square.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-Ll0lm-VCAIEueYR5KVC_description
attribs.current: Lord Nar flies into a rage that lasts 1 minute and grants him 8 temporary Hit Points, 4 additional damage with his listed attacks, and a –1 penalty to AC. He cannot use actions that have the concentrate trait while raging, unless they also have the rage trait. Once his rage ends, Nar cannot Rage again for 1 minute.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-Ll0HbneSAB33frFmWnS_description
attribs.current: Anyone bitten by a mangy wolf is sickened 1 for 1 minute unless they succeed at a DC 14 Fortitude save, but they can spend an Interact action to scratch away the fleas and remove the condition.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-Ll0IvssZuOhKNiaQAs2_description
attribs.current: Trigger A creature critically hits a mutant wolf while adjacent to it. Effect The wound causes gore to spray from a ruptured pustule. The triggering creature takes [[3d6]] (3d6) acid damage (DC 19 basic Reflex save). This occurs even if the attack kills the wolf.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-Ll0Z9Xhx5vaqiRrpl9F_description
attribs.current: Trigger The wolf dealt damage to a creature with its jaws during the previous action. Effect The wolf tears at the creature’s flesh, dealing [[1d6+2]] (1d6+2) slashing damage and 1 persistent acid damage.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-Ll0TujAQlzjAZb1onY2_description
attribs.current: Frequency once per day; Fierceness in battle runs through your blood, and you refuse to fall from your injuries. You avoid being knocked out and remain at 1 Hit Point, and your wounded condition increases by 1.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-Ll0TujAQlzjAZb1onY2_trigger
attribs.current: You would be reduced to 0 Hit Points but not immediately killed.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-Ll0TpXSJvurdpsl8zoc_description
attribs.current: Frequency once per day; Fierceness in battle runs through your blood, and you refuse to fall from your injuries. You avoid being knocked out and remain at 1 Hit Point, and your wounded condition increases by 1.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-Ll0TpXSJvurdpsl8zoc_trigger
attribs.current: You would be reduced to 0 Hit Points but not immediately killed.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-Ll0WH7AWBQtrHcbAUI9_description
attribs.current: The hooves of the stone horse are as hard as iron; if the horse makes a Hoof Strike and gets a critical hit, the target’s armor is damaged as well, the attack dealing as much damage to the armor as it dealt to the target (Hardness applies as normal). If the target uses shield block against the stone horse’s critical hit with a hoof attack, treat the shield’s Hardness as 5 points lower (minimum 0).

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-Ll0nUeF8CT2FIPUFwQL_description
attribs.current: The amalgam can make up to four Strikes, one with each of its listed melee attacks, but no more than two at any one target. It takes a –2 penalty to each attack, but the multiple attack penalty does not increase until all the attacks are made.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-Ll0oO7tmRzMIE9P3vXv_description
attribs.current: The Amalgam has many consciousnesses floating inside its mind, and they are not equally affected by mental magic. The Amalgam always treats its saving throws against mental effects as one degree better.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-Ll0q1AuX03EOLiOULqf_description
attribs.current: The behemoth makes a melee Strike and, if the attack hits, it can push the creature back 10 feet (20 feet on a critical hit). The target must succeed at a DC 19 Fortitude save or be knocked prone by this attack.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-Ll0qAZPbce2kYnqhcnR_description
attribs.current: The behemoth can stomp on the ground, causing all creatures within 10 feet to fall prone (DC 19 Reflex save negates).

attribs.current: Frequency once per day; Fierceness in battle runs through your blood, and you refuse to fall from you rin juries. You avoid being knocked out and remain at 1 Hit Point, and your wounded condition increases by 1.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-Ll0roJN4CIIW3Ux9ZDS_description
attribs.current: The Sculptor has used his alchemy ability to create 4 moderate alchemist’s fire, 2 lesser elixirs of life, and 4 moderate frost vials. These are infusions. He can spend an action to create an additional vial of any one of those, lesser bottled lightning, or a lesser acid flask.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-Ll0rvd1ZtxXiv4tCftC_description
attribs.current: The Sculptor can use Interact to draw a bomb and then Strike with it.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-Ll0aM2LBscuYrta6C0T_description
attribs.current: Each enemy in the bat swarm’s space takes [[1d4]] (1d4) piercing damage (DC 16 basic Reflex save). Creatures that fail this save also take 1 persistent bleed damage

attribs.name: repeating_interaction-abilities_-Ll3XZE3G0NCOGwoeEcr_description
attribs.current: A bat swarm can use its hearing as a precise sense at the listed range.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-Ll0uS2fdTzkHRcx0rV1_description
attribs.current: Vilree’s crossbow can deliver bolts that are alchemically infused. As an action, she can slot an alchemical bomb into the crossbow, and the next 3 attacks she makes with it deal [[1d6]] (1d6) damage of the type dealt by the bomb. These attacks never deal splash damage.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-Ll0uZ1wKq20kAd6tU5u_description
attribs.current: Vilree has used her alchemy ability to create 4 moderate acid flasks, 6 moderate alchemist’s fire, 2 moderate bottled lightnings, 3 lesser elixirs of life, and 2 lesser tanglefoot bags. These are infusions. She can spend an action to create an additional vial of any one of these items, or any of the items listed as formulas in her book.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-Ll0udnyGdyoE26FrtxD_description
attribs.current: Vilree’s bombs have a range increment of 30 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-Ll0uh3a-PWomitX-Fay_description
attribs.current: Vilree can interact to draw a bomb and then make a Strike with it.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-Ll0cAZSw91--D8GvFpE_description
attribs.current: A creature grabbed by a vine lasher is not immobilized, but the grabbed creature’s space and every adjacent square use the rules for difficult terrain. If the creature moves, the vine lasher moves with it, always keeping the grabbed creature within 10 feet of itself. If two or more vine lashers have a creature grabbed in this way, then the target’s space and adjacent square instead use the rules for greater difficult terrain.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-Ll0d25aoaiHnMMyqX8e_description
attribs.current: The zephyr hawk Flies up to half its Speed, makes two wing Strikes, then Flies up to half its Speed again to return to its original location. The second half of this movement doesn’t trigger reactions. Both attacks count toward the zephyr hawk’s multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn’t increase until after it makes both attacks.

attribs.name: repeating_items-worn_-LlI-77gozAMyYkrx2Ti_worn_item_notes
attribs.current: A mix of furs, sturdy hide, and sometimes molded boiled leather, this armor provides protection due to its layers of leather, though its bulkiness slows the wearer down and decreases mobility.

attribs.name: repeating_items-worn_-LlI-ksPZdO09Z1oqmrz_worn_item_notes
attribs.current: A backpack holds up to 4 Bulk of items. If you’re carrying or stowing the pack rather than wearing it on your back, its bulk is light instead of negligible.

attribs.name: repeating_items-worn_-LlI0R1dt1fjA1FJZTUu_worn_item_notes
attribs.current: This broad-bladed sword, sometimes called the hand‑and‑a‑half sword, has a longer grip so it can be held in one hand or used with two hands to provide extra piercing or slashing power.

attribs.name: repeating_items-worn_-LlI3S6j6xkiyLKiF03Z_worn_item_notes
attribs.current: This thin spear is well balanced for throwing but is not designed for melee use.

attribs.name: repeating_items-other_-LlI7uYkPm6hCfgtTVop_other_item_notes
attribs.current:
Elixir of Life (Item 1+)
Alchemical, Consumable, Elixir, Healing
Usage held in 1 hand; Bulk L
Activate [one-action] Interact 

Elixirs of life accelerate the body's natural healing processes and immune system. Upon drinking this elixir, you regain the listed number of Hit Points and gain an item bonus to saving throws against diseases and poisons for 10 minutes.

Type minor; Level 1; Price 3 gp
The elixir restores 1d6 Hit Points, and the bonus is +1.

attribs.name: repeating_items-other_-LlI8KW3jceY7cog0LZ5_other_item_notes
attribs.current: Flint and steel are useful in creating a fire if you have the time to catch a spark, though using them is typically too time-consuming to be practical during an encounter. Even in ideal conditions, using flint and steel to light a flame requires using at least 3 actions, and often significantly longer.

attribs.name: repeating_items-other_-LlI8Z4tLVMs7DlHtBZT_other_item_notes
attribs.current: You can throw a grappling hook with a rope tied to it to make a climb easier. To anchor a grappling hook, make an attack roll with the secret trait against a DC depending on the target, typically at least DC 20. On a success, your hook has a firm hold, but on a critical failure, the hook seems like it will hold but actually falls when you’re partway up.

attribs.current: A torch sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light to the next 20 feet). It can be used as an improvised weapon that deals 1d4 bludgeoning damage plus 1 fire damage.

attribs.name: repeating_items-other_-LlIASKKew-n7hIVZ9cd_other_item_notes
attribs.current: When it’s full, a waterskin has 1 Bulk and contains roughly 1 day’s worth of water for a Small or Medium creature.

attribs.name: repeating_feat-ancestry_-LlIBA7jmL5fCTHw1jBv_feat_ancestry_notes
attribs.current: You were raised to be ambitious and always reach for the stars, leading you to progress quickly in your chosen field. You gain a 1st-level class feat for your class. You must meet the prerequisites, but you can select the feat later in the character creation process in order to determine which prerequisites you meet.

attribs.name: repeating_feat-class_-LlIBSjHYTc-nkM53PGj_feat_class_notes
attribs.current: Your fury fills your foes with fear. While you are raging, your Demoralize and Scare to Death actions (from the Intimidation skill and an Intimidation skill feat, respectively) gain the rage trait, allowing you to use them while raging. As soon as you meet the prerequisites for the skill feats Intimidating Glare and Scare to Death, you gain these feats.

attribs.name: repeating_feat-class_-LlIBuotTxK4ZuIKGlZt_feat_class_notes
attribs.current: With a quick sprint, you dash up to your foe and swing. Stride twice. If you end your movement within melee reach of at least one enemy, you can make a melee Strike against that enemy. You can use Sudden Charge while Burrowing, Climbing, Flying, or Swimming instead of Striding if you have the corresponding movement type.

attribs.name: repeating_feat-general_-LlIC5Xg1qbToBNxIlnE_feat_general_notes
attribs.current: It takes more to kill you than most. You die from the dying condition at dying 5, rather than dying 4.

attribs.name: repeating_feat-skill_-LlICF5e5chExWCzKxMl_feat_skill_notes
attribs.current:
General, Skill
Prerequisites trained in Intimidation

You can Demoralize with a mere glare. When you do, Demoralize loses the auditory trait and gains the visual trait, and you don’t take a penalty if the creature doesn’t understand your language.

attribs.name: repeating_feat-skill_-LlICKW1zPttUKCptPFM_feat_skill_notes
attribs.current:
General, Skill
Prerequisites trained in Survival

You can study details in the wilderness to determine the presence of nearby creatures. You can spend 10 minutes assessing the area around you to find out what creatures are nearby, based on nests, scat, and marks on vegetation. Attempt a Survival check against a DC determined by the GM based on how obvious the signs are. On a success, you can attempt a Recall Knowledge check with a –2 penalty to learn more about the creatures just from these signs. If you’re a master in Survival, you don’t take the penalty.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-LlICr-Dqy5WRmSFRGmj_description
attribs.current: Failing to face a personal challenge of strength is anathema.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-LlICtlL787Oq1sw4ZV9_description
attribs.current: Your rage gives you the raw power and size of a giant. This doesn’t necessarily mean you revere giants—you might scoff at them or even aspire to slay them! You could instead seem like a giant to other people due to your exceptional strength or larger-than-life emotions and ego.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-LlIDJTN5C8SrFGms25p_description
attribs.current:
Requirements You aren’t fatigued or raging.
You tap into your inner fury and begin raging. You gain a number of temporary Hit Points equal to your level plus your Constitution modifier. This frenzy lasts for 1 minute, until there are no enemies you can perceive, or until you fall unconscious, whichever comes first. You can’t voluntarily stop raging. While you are raging:

You deal 2 additional damage with melee weapons and unarmed attacks. This additional damage is halved if your weapon or unarmed attack is agile.
You take a –1 penalty to AC.
You can’t use actions with the concentrate trait unless they also have the rage trait. You can Seek while raging.
After you stop raging, you lose any remaining temporary Hit Points from Rage, and you can’t Rage again for 1 minute.

attribs.name: campaign_notes
attribs.current: Hunter: You stalked and took down animals and other creatures of the wild. Skinning animals, harvesting their flesh, and cooking them were also part of your training, all of which can give you useful resources while you adventure.

attribs.name: repeating_senses_-LlhFnlaPLMpbqr4MUAf_sense_notes
attribs.current: A creature with darkvision can see perfectly well in areas of darkness and dim light, though such vision is in black and white only. Some forms of magical darkness, such as a 4th-level Darkness spell, block normal darkvision.

attribs.name: repeating_resistances-immunities_-LlhL2m9wskVlztZ216w_resistances_and_immunities_notes
attribs.current: Your blood runs hearty and strong, and you can shake off toxins. You gain poison resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1), and each of your successful saving throws against a poison affliction reduces its stage by 2, or by 1 for a virulent poison. Each critical success against an ongoing poison reduces its stage by 3, or by 2 for a virulent poison.

attribs.name: repeating_feat-ancestry_-LlhM5XWOVdXL2yvc57T_feat_ancestry_notes
attribs.current: A creature with darkvision can see perfectly well in areas of darkness and dim light, though such vision is in black and white only. Some forms of magical darkness, such as a 4th-level Darkness spell, block normal darkvision.

attribs.name: repeating_feat-ancestry_-LlhMGyPBMGul1K9D9TK_feat_ancestry_notes
attribs.current:
Your kin have instilled in you an affinity for hard-hitting weapons, and you prefer these to more elegant arms. You are trained with the battle axe, pick, and warhammer.
You also gain access to all uncommon dwarf weapons. For the purpose of determining your proficiency, martial dwarf weapons are simple weapons and advanced dwarf weapons are martial weapons.

attribs.name: repeating_feat-ancestry_-LlhN2aw5aTcScFgGnhC_feat_ancestry_notes
attribs.current: Your blood runs hearty and strong, and you can shake off toxins. You gain poison resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1), and each of your successful saving throws against a poison affliction reduces its stage by 2, or by 1 for a virulent poison. Each critical success against an ongoing poison reduces its stage by 3, or by 2 for a virulent poison.

attribs.name: repeating_feat-class_-LlhNOhguQelW4ocYxc1_feat_class_notes
attribs.current: You have a deep understanding of the crossbow. When you’re wielding a crossbow and use Hunt Prey or use Interact to reload your crossbow, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to the damage roll on your next Strike with that crossbow. If the crossbow is a simple crossbow, also increase the damage die size for that attack by one step. You must make the attack before the end of your next turn or these benefits are lost.

attribs.name: repeating_feat-class_-LlhNjil6mHvwOi3gpYk_feat_class_notes
attribs.current: When you focus your attention on a single foe, you become unstoppable in your pursuit. You gain the Hunt Prey action.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-LlhOXFhmA3bh1pv-0nU_description
attribs.current:
You designate a single creature as your prey and focus your attacks against that creature. You must be able to see or hear the prey, or you must be tracking the prey during exploration.
You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks when you Seek your prey and a +2 circumstance bonus to Survival checks when you Track your prey. You also ignore the penalty for making ranged attacks within your second range increment against the prey you’re hunting.
You can have only one creature designated as your prey at a time. If you use Hunt Prey against a creature when you already have a creature designated, the prior creature loses the designation and the new prey gains the designation. Your designation lasts until your next daily preparations.

attribs.name: repeating_feat-class_-LlhOzOErvvdMmUC8mda_feat_class_notes
attribs.current: You have trained to unleash a devastating flurry of attacks upon your prey. Your multiple attack penalty for attacks against your hunted prey is -3 (-2 with an agile weapon) on your second attack of the turn instead of -5, and -6 (-4 with an agile weapon) on your third or subsequent attack of the turn, instead of -10.

attribs.name: repeating_feat-skill_-LlhNKfmIbRlzdJvZhYX_feat_skill_notes
attribs.current:
While using Survival to Subsist, if you roll any result worse than a success, you get a success. On a success, you can provide subsistence living for yourself and four additional creatures, and on a critical success, you can take care of twice as many creatures as on a success. 
Each time your proficiency rank in Survival increases, double the number of additional creatures you can take care of on a success (to eight if you’re an expert, 16 if you’re a master, or 32 if you’re legendary). You can choose to care for half the number of additional creatures and provide a comfortable living instead of subsistence living.
Multiple smaller creatures or creatures with significantly smaller appetites than a human are counted as a single creature for this feat, and larger creatures or those with significantly greater appetites each count as multiple creatures. The GM determines how much a non-human creature needs to eat.

attribs.name: repeating_feat-class_-LliNw6yNRXgYq8M4qys_feat_class_notes
attribs.current:
You add a flourish to your composition to extend its benefits. If your next action is to cast a cantrip composition with a Duration of 1 round, attempt a Performance check. The DC is usually a standard-difficulty DC of a level equal to the highest‑level target of your composition, but the GM can assign a different DC based on the circumstances. The Effect depends on the result of your check.

Critical Success: The composition lasts 4 rounds.
Success: The composition lasts 3 rounds.
Failure: The composition lasts 1 round, but you don't spend the Focus Point for casting this spell.

attribs.name: repeating_spellfocus_-LliOsBEpFUDtIzm1cbj_description

attribs.name: repeating_feat-skill_-LliPYFP7g-PfDMQJZLr_feat_skill_notes
attribs.current:
Prerequisites trained in Performance

When you Perform, compare your result to the Will DC of one observer. If you succeed, the target is Fascinated by you for 1 round. If the observer is in a situation that demands immediate attention, such as combat, you must critically succeed to fascinate it and the Perform action gains the Incapacitation trait. You must choose which creature you’re trying to fascinate before you roll your check, and the target is then temporarily immune for 1 hour.

If you’re an expert in Performance, you can fascinate up to four observers; if you’re a master, you can fascinate up to 10 observers; and if you’re legendary, you can fascinate any number of observers at the same time.

attribs.name: repeating_feat-class_-LliPlTJ1krWpFzHZLez_feat_class_notes
attribs.current:
As a bard, you select one muse at 1st level. This muse leads you to great things, and might be a physical creature, a deity, a philosophy, or a captivating mystery.

Your muse is a virtuoso, inspiring you to greater heights. If it’s a creature, it might be a performance-loving creature such as a choral angel or lillend azata; if a deity, it might be Shelyn. As a bard with a maestro muse, you are an inspiration to your allies and confident of your musical and oratorical abilities. You gain the Lingering Composition feat and add Soothe to your spell repertoire.

attribs.current: Uncommon, Bard, Cantrip, Composition, Emotion, Enchantment, Mental

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-LliYy0bQ15Zlzi8gDse_description
attribs.current: You inspire your allies with words or tunes of encouragement. You and all allies in the area gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, and saves against fear effects.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-LliZQk6dUN9cs2j4pfU_description
attribs.current:
The object glows, casting bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light for the next 20 feet) like a torch. If you cast this spell again on a second object, the light spell on the first object ends.

Heightened (4th): The object sheds bright light in a 60-foot radius (and dim light for the next 60 feet).

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-LliZQk6dUN9cs2j4pfU_duration
attribs.current: Until the next time you make your daily preparations

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-LliZQk6dUN9cs2j4pfU_target
attribs.current: 1 unattended, non-magical object of 1 Bulk or less

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-LliZzAiuKrJ-yuIRSVT_description
attribs.current:
The simplest magic does your bidding. You can perform simple magical effects for as long as you Sustain the Spell. Each time you Sustain the Spell, you can choose one of four options.

-Cook: Cool, warm, or flavor 1 pound of nonliving material.
-Lift: Slowly lift an unattended object of light Bulk or less 1 foot off the ground.
-Make: Create a temporary object of negligible Bulk, made of congealed magical substance. The object looks crude and artificial and is extremely fragile—it can't be used as a tool, weapon, or spell component.
-Tidy: Color, clean, or soil an object of light Bulk or less. You can affect an object of 1 Bulk with 10 rounds of concentration, and a larger object a 1 minute per Bulk.
Prestidigitation can't deal damage or cause adverse conditions. Any actual change to an object (beyond what is noted above) persists only as long as you Sustain the Spell.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-LliZZ-c5sMt0RBvJCpw_description
attribs.current:
You hurl a loose, unattended object that is within range and that has 1 Bulk or less at the target. Make a ranged attack against the target. If you hit, you deal bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage—as appropriate for the object you hurled—equal to 1d6 plus your spellcasting ability modifier. No specific traits or magic properties of the hurled item affect the attack or the damage. 

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-M8ehglyRIMWQP4j9QNy_description
attribs.current:
To the target, your words are honey and your visage seems bathed in a dreamy haze. It must attempt a Will save, with a +4 circumstance bonus if you or your allies recently threatened it or used hostile actions against it.

You can Dismiss the spell. If you use hostile actions against the target, the spell ends. When the spell ends, the target doesn't necessarily realize it was charmed unless its friendship with you or the actions you convinced it to take clash with its expectations, meaning you could potentially convince the target to continue being your friend via mundane means.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-M8ehglyRIMWQP4j9QNy_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: The target's attitude becomes helpful toward you, and it can't use hostile actions against you.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-M8ehglyRIMWQP4j9QNy_save_critical_success
attribs.current: The target is unaffected and aware you tried to charm it.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-M8ehglyRIMWQP4j9QNy_save_failure
attribs.current: The target's attitude becomes friendly toward you. If it was friendly, it becomes helpful. It can't use hostile actions against you.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-M8ehglyRIMWQP4j9QNy_save_success
attribs.current: The target is unaffected but thinks your spell was something harmless instead of charm, unless it identifies the spell (usually with Identify Magic).

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-M8ehglyRIMWQP4j9QNz_description
attribs.current:
You plant fear in the target; it must attempt a Will save.

Heightened (3rd) You can target up to five creatures.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-M8ehglyRIMWQP4j9QNz_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: The target is frightened 3 and fleeing for 1 round.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-M8ehglzbNc9KF4gmDRR_description
attribs.current:
You grace the target's mind, boosting its mental defenses and healing its wounds. The target regains 1d10+4 Hit Points when you Cast the Spell and gains a +2 status bonus to saves against mental effects for the duration.

Heightened (+1) The amount of healing increases by 1d10+4.

attribs.name: repeating_actions_-M8ehgx5h04xPlHhjlxZ_description
attribs.current:
Usage held in 1 hand

When this stone hits a creature or a hard surface, it explodes with a deafening bang. A thunderstone deals the listed sonic damage and sonic splash damage, and each creature within 10 feet of the space in which the stone exploded must succeed at a Fortitude saving throw with the listed DC or be deafened until the end of its next turn. Many types of thunderstone grant an item bonus to attack rolls. 

Type lesser; Level 1; Price 3 gp
The bomb deals 1d4 sonic damage and 1 sonic splash damage, and the DC is 17.

attribs.name: repeating_actions_-M8ehgx5h04xPlHhjlxa_trigger
attribs.current: You fail a skill check or saving throw.

attribs.name: repeating_actions_-M8ehgx5h04xPlHhjlxa_description
attribs.current:
Frequency: once per day

Your happy-go-lucky nature makes it seem like misfortune avoids you, and to an extent, that might even be true. You can reroll the triggering check, but you must use the new result, even if it’s worse than your first roll.

attribs.name: repeating_items-other_-Llohv91DBNUlS1DbHWu_other_item_notes
attribs.current: Upon drinking this elixir, you regain 1d6 Hit Points and gain a +1 item bonus to saving throws against diseases and potions for 10 minutes.

attribs.name: repeating_items-other_-LlohmsJFCOkRze-RnbZ_other_item_notes
attribs.current: This kit is necessary for Medicine checks to Administer First Aid, Treat a Disease, Treat a Poison, or Treat Wounds.

attribs.name: repeating_items-other_-LlohpCieCk0mjP9Mzvz_other_item_notes
attribs.current: These plants of supernatural significance act as a primal focus for druids when held in one hand.

attribs.name: repeating_feat-class_-LlolBIIUcukI2Nfj8M1_feat_class_notes
attribs.current: You must not commit wanton cruelty to animals, kill animals unnecessarily, use metal armor or shields, or teach the Druidic language to non-druids. If you flagrantly or repeatedly violate these prohibitions, you might lose your primal spellcasting and animal companion abilities.

attribs.name: repeating_feat-class_-LlokEwzcymc-2myM2ja_feat_class_notes
attribs.current: The young snow leopard Droogami serves as Lini's companion and protector. Lini can use the Command an Animal action to give Droogami two actions.

attribs.name: repeating_feat-ancestry_-LlokBLDGKb50cgWkYZe_feat_ancestry_notes
attribs.current: You can speak to small, chittering, ground creatures, allowing you to ask questions and recieve answers from them, as well as using the Diplomacy skill (this applies to small animals with a burrow Speed, such as badgers, ground squirrels, moles, or prairie dogs.

attribs.name: repeating_feat-skill_-LlokHkokY7JmMoGEIki_feat_skill_notes
attribs.current: You can use Nature instead of Medicine to Treat Wounds. While in the wilderness, you may have access to fresher ingredients that grant a +2 circumstance bonus to your check (at GM's discretion).

attribs.name: repeating_feat-class_-LlokxHXCV8NITJvw634_feat_class_notes
attribs.current: You can cast primal spells using the Cast a Spell activity. See the Spells section for details on the spells you can cast.

attribs.name: repeating_feat-ancestry_-LlomSeqRXTSuBOP0uQu_feat_ancestry_notes
attribs.current: You have the ability to locate creatures by scent (imprecise, 30 feet), allowing you to determine the exact location of a creature by sense of smell. In addition, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks when attempting to locate an undetected creature within your range of scent.

attribs.name: repeating_feat-class_-Llol2n5JrZUR11vtMZe_feat_class_notes
attribs.current: You can use Diplomacy to Make an Impression on animals and make very simple Requests of them. In most cases, wild animals will give you time to make your case.

attribs.name: repeating_feat-class_-Llokt4hzfsrQYd9MKF5_feat_class_notes
attribs.current: You have a strong connection to beasts, and you are allied with a beast companion.

attribs.name: repeating_feat-class_-LlokziZrn6hAEs8Tp7B_feat_class_notes
attribs.current: You snap your shield in place to ward off a blow. Your shield prevents you from taking an amount of damage up to the shield’s Hardness. You and the shield each take any remaining damage, possibly breaking or destroying the shield.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-LloqQApUakPmqlkE0-k_description
attribs.current: Make a spell attack roll against the target; if you hit, you deal 1d6 acid damage plus 1 splash acid damage. On a critical success, the target also takes 1 persistent acid damage.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-LlrPYaFasYUHgSsuyFZ_description
attribs.current: You send out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. You receive no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. You can choose to ignore magic you’re fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of you and your allies.You detect illusion magic only if that magic’s effect has a lower level than the level of your detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren’t deceptive in appearance (such as an invisibility potion) are typically detected normally.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-LlrQP9oU51pm8bjoKNX_description
attribs.current: You fire an arc of lightning that leaps from one target to another. You deal 1d4+4 electricity damage to up to 2 creatures within 30 feet. Those creatures must attempt a basic Reflex save.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-LlrYY5ZQQtHbruugHPS_description
attribs.current: A small ball of flame appears in the palm of your hand, and you lash out with it either in melee or at range. Make a spell attack roll against your target’s AC. This is normally a ranged attack with a range of 30 feet, but you can also make a melee attack against a creature in your unarmed reach. On a success, you deal 1d4+4 fire damage. On a critical success, the target takes double damage and 1d4 persistent fire damage.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-LlrZ98I6dIBB-bHI56b_description
attribs.current:
A vine covered in sticky sap appears from thin air, flicking from your hand and lashing itself to the target. Attempt a spell attack against a creature within 30 feet.

Critical Success: The target gains the immobilized condition and takes a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. It can attempt to Escape against your spell DC to remove the penalty and the immobilized condition.

Success: The target takes a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. It can attempt to Escape against your spell DC to remove the penalty.

Failure: The target is unaffected

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-M8ehPfi4WNlgZUewkrk_description
attribs.current:
You channel positive energy to heal living creatures and harm undead. If the target is a living creature, you restore 1d8 Hit Points. If the target is undead, you deal that amount of positive damage to it, and it must attempt a basic Fortitude save. 

You can spend more actions when Casting this Spell to affect its targets, range, area, and other parameters.

[one-action] (somatic) The spell has a range of touch.
[two-actions](verbal, somatic):The spell has a range of 30 feet. If you’re healing a living creature, increase the Hit Points restored by 8.
[three-actions](material, somatic, verbal)The positive energy is dispersed in a 30-foot emanation, targeting all living and undead creatures in the area (this does not include the additional healing from the 2-action option).

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-M8ehPfi4WNlgZUewkrk_target
attribs.current: 1 willing living creature or 1 undead creature

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-M8ehPfi4WNlgZUewkrl_description
attribs.current: Choose one creature you can touch; for the next minute one of their unarmed attacks that deals one damage die becomes a +1 striking unarmed attack, gaining a +1 item bonus to attack rolls and increasing the number of damage dice to two.

attribs.name: repeating_melee-strikes_-LlhRNKLtuZ2kthdls2L_damage_display
attribs.current: 1D8+2 S plus agile, finesse, nonlethal, unarmed

attribs.name: repeating_feat-skill_-LlmvL6KRRHkXiIxQZT3_feat_skill_notes

attribs.name: repeating_feat-class_-LlmvR1Lb6vOtsQs1bMl_feat_class_notes

attribs.name: repeating_feat-class_-LlmvZcSEHEiHZh2HtVZ_feat_class_notes

As long as your Speed is at least 20 feet while in tiger stance, you can Step 10 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_feat-ancestry_-LlmwNj5O1zjtDsh3D9f_feat_ancestry_notes
attribs.current: You are trained with all martial weapons, including the temple sword.

attribs.name: repeating_feat-class_-LlmwaGeeNtswl0yHEbE_feat_class_notes

attribs.current: A backpack holds up to 4 Bulk of items. If you’re carrying or stowing the pack rather than wearing it on your back, its bulk is light instead of negligible.

attribs.name: repeating_items-worn_-LlmxNdy3XrG5IDz2-B7_worn_item_notes
attribs.current: Explorer’s clothing is sturdy enough that it can be reinforced to protect you, even though it isn’t a suit of armor. It comes in many forms, though the most common sorts look like clerical vestments, monk’s garments, or wizard’s robes, as members of all three classes are likely to avoid wearing armor.

attribs.name: repeating_items-worn_-LlmxsRiufXkOaevz57O_worn_item_notes
attribs.current: The target takes 1d6 persistent bleed damage. You gain an item bonus to this bleed damage equal to the weapon’s item bonus to attack rolls.

attribs.name: repeating_items-other_-Llmy8sb2hr9qRXVgX4w_other_item_notes

attribs.name: repeating_items-other_-LlmyVu1fN59TaqYSQN-_other_item_notes
attribs.current: Flint and steel are useful in creating a fire if you have the time to catch a spark, though using them is typically too time-consuming to be practical during an encounter. Even in ideal conditions, using flint and steel to light a flame requires using at least 3 actions, and often signifuicantly longer.

attribs.name: repeating_items-other_-LlmyZDJG0799P0gttr7_other_item_notes
attribs.current: You can throw a grappling hook with a rope tied to it to make a climb easier. To anchor a grappling hook, make an attack roll with the secret trait against a DC depending on the target, typically at least DC 20. On a success, your hook has a firm hold, but on a critical failure, the hook seems like it will hold but actually falls when you’re partway up.

attribs.name: repeating_items-other_-Llmybnvc2ctq8shPeZJ_other_item_notes

attribs.current: A torch sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light to the next 20 feet). It can be used as an improvised weapon that deals 1d4 bludgeoning damage plus 1 fire damage.

attribs.name: repeating_items-other_-Llmz5ZFXhto4wQXpdxe_other_item_notes

attribs.name: repeating_feat-ancestry_-LlnNCs19W2A8M7lyIly_feat_ancestry_notes

attribs.current: Droogami deals 1d4 extra precision damage against flat-footed targets

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-Llrzd7wCIJELMZaLvmc_description
attribs.current: Droogami throws your enemies off-balance when you create an opening. Until the start of your next turn, your Strikes that deal damage to a creature that Droogami threatens make the target flat-footed until the end of your next turn.

attribs.name: repeating_lore_-LrAaDJw3ZZNgC4m8gau_lore_notes
attribs.current: Applies to the place the ghost is bound to

attribs.name: immunities
attribs.current: death effects, disease, paralyzed, poison, precision, unconscious

attribs.name: resistances
attribs.current: all damage 5 (except force, ghost touch, positive; double resistance vs. non-magical)

attribs.name: repeating_interaction-abilities_-LrAb5NlefSoskZaB2i7_description
attribs.current: Setting right the injustice that led to the commoner's death allows it to move on to the afterlife.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-LrAbUkXvd8ktbRO-hcx_description
attribs.current: The ghost laments its fate, forcing each living creature within 30 feet to attempt a Will save. On a failure, a creature becomes frightened 2 (or frightened 3 on a critical failure). On a success, a creature is temporarily immune to this ghost’s frightful moan for 1 minute.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-LrAbUkXvd8ktbRO-hcx_rep_traits
attribs.current: Auditory, divine, emotion, enchantment, fear, mental
